Key Match Events: Lane Thomas had four RBIs and the Cleveland Guardians held on behind their bullpen to beat the Chicago White Sox 6-4.
Austin Hedges added a solo home run for the AL Central-leading Guardians.
Cleveland Guardians closing pitcher Emmanuel Clase celebrated after defeating the Chicago White Sox 6-4.
Chicago White Sox starting pitcher Davis Martin reacted after giving up a solo home run to Cleveland Guardians’ Austin Hedges.
Chicago White Sox’s Lenyn Sosa watched his RBI single during the third inning.
Cleveland Guardians starter Matthew Boyd threw during the first inning.
Post-Match Reflections: First-year Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt said, 'I feel incredible about it. This was a tough road trip, this late in the year to be gone through three cities and play some tough teams.'

Lane Thomas said, 'I’m just going to try to keep being consistent with the work and build off what we’re doing right now. It’s been fun and I feel like we’re winning some games right now. So just keep that, you know, just carry that through the rest of September.'
Chicago’s Davis Martin said, 'Everybody pissed. Every time we go score four runs for me, it’s like, hey, that’s well in the ballpark for us to get a victory. It’s my job to set the tone.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago dropped a franchise-record 15th straight at home, lost its 17th in 19 overall and was swept for the 24th time.
At 33-114, the White Sox are closing in on the post-1900 record for losses — 120 by the 1962 New York Mets in their inaugural season.
The Guardians finished 6-3 on a three-city trip that included stops in Kansas City and at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles.
Cleveland and New York are tied for the best record in the American League.
